title: Constipation: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass. The stool is often hard and dry. Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, bloating, and feeling as if one has not completely passed the bowel movement. Complications from constipation may include hemorrhoids, anal fissure or fecal impaction. The normal frequency of bowel movements in adults is between three per day and three per week. Babies often have three to four bowel movements per day while young children typically have two to three per day. 
Constipation has many causes. Common causes include slow movement of stool within the colon, irritable bowel syndrome, and pelvic floor disorders. Underlying associated diseases include hypothyroidism, diabetes, Parkinson's disease, celiac disease, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, colon cancer, diverticulitis, and inflammatory bowel disease. Medications associated with constipation include opioids, certain antacids, calcium channel blockers, and anticholinergics. Of those taking opioids about 90% develop constipation. Constipation is more concerning when there is weight loss or anemia, blood is present in the stool, there is a history of inflammatory bowel disease or colon cancer in a person's family, or it is of new onset in someone who is older. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Constipation Guide, Constipation Disease Management & Constipation Disease causes.
Here are features that make this app better than all other Constipation Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications.

title: IBD Circle
description:
"IBD Circle is a free application provided by the Brigham and Women‚Äôs Hospital Crohn's and Colitis Center and currently requires a specific invitation by your care team to utilize these programs. If you would like more information, please contact your gastroenterologist for instructions or email circleteam@partners.org.
 
This app provides a wide range of tools and educational materials for patients and their families to help better manage their condition:
- There is a Symptom Diary to monitor disease activity
- The App includes Journals for lifestyle and nutrition, and a detailed quality of life index to help patients track trends in their own health. 
- There is a Medical Content Library specifically for patients with Crohn's Disease and Ulcerative Colitis and a detailed glossary ‚Äì both with pictures, images, and videos, and multimedia materials.
- The App features a meditations section with podcasts to use for sessions at home.
- The App has a checklist to keep track of recommended labs and healthcare maintenance
- The App has an inbox for messaging and reminders.
 
Thank you for your support of Brigham and Women‚Äôs Hospital and the Crohn's and Colitis Center."

title: Constipation: Causes, Diagnosis, and Treatment
description:
Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass. The stool is often hard and dry. Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, bloating, and feeling as if one has not completely passed the bowel movement. Complications from constipation may include hemorrhoids, anal fissure or fecal impaction. The normal frequency of bowel movements in adults is between three per day and three per week. Babies often have three to four bowel movements per day while young children typically have two to three per day. 
Constipation has many causes. Common causes include slow movement of stool within the colon, irritable bowel syndrome, and pelvic floor disorders. Underlying associated diseases include hypothyroidism, diabetes, Parkinson's disease, celiac disease, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, colon cancer, diverticulitis, and inflammatory bowel disease. Medications associated with constipation include opioids, certain antacids, calcium channel blockers, and anticholinergics. Of those taking opioids about 90% develop constipation. Constipation is more concerning when there is weight loss or anemia, blood is present in the stool, there is a history of inflammatory bowel disease or colon cancer in a person's family, or it is of new onset in someone who is older. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Constipation Guide, Constipation Disease Management & Constipation Disease causes.
Here are features that make this app better than all other Constipation Disease apps - 
-	UI of app is very user responsive and easy to navigate. 
-	Easily Change the page.
-	Data of app is collected from various research reports.
-	You can access these favorites whenever you want.
-	Share your favorite benefits with your friends and family through email, SMS, Twitter, Facebook, and WhatsApp.

All these features are available for free. 

==========================
SAY HELLO
==========================
Any medical information published on this app is not intended as a substitute for informed medical advice and you should not take any action before consulting with a healthcare professional. Our team are nonstop working hard on creation this app. Please feel free to review and email us for any questions/suggestions/complications.

title: IBD Circle
description:
"IBD Circle is a free application provided by the Brigham and Women‚Äôs Hospital Crohn's and Colitis Center and currently requires a specific invitation by your care team to utilize these programs. If you would like more information, please contact your gastroenterologist for instructions or email circleteam@partners.org.

Thank you for your support of Brigham and Women‚Äôs Hospital and the Crohn's and Colitis Center."

title: Crohn's Assistant
description:
I made this android phone application because I've been suffering from Crohn's disease since 2010. I utilized my personal experience about the disease and developed the content of the application to serve my needs. I hope that it will help some of you, because it helped me manage my illness.

In the app:

- You can store and analyze your blood tests. You can attach images(using the camera of the phone) about your blood tests. Mark some important value as favorite and query for them.
- Store multiple symptoms on the same day. Rate them from 1 to 5 and analyze the symptom graph.
- Store multiple meal on a day
- Store your medicines ( dosage, frequency, type, opening date). The program tries to estimate, when your medicine will be empty.
- Store your examinations (multiple examination can be stored for one day). You can query the last examinations by type.
- You can export the symptoms and meal to CSV file and you can send it to your doctor
- You can store information about stool


You can download the application from the google play store.

More about the app: http://www.lebersoftware.hu/crohn_assistant

title: Food and Symptoms Diary
description:
This mobile food and symptoms diary enables you to narrow down food intolerances such as lactose, histamine or sorbitol intolerance, fructose malabsorption or food allergies. It can also be used to determine your personal threshold (tolerance level) for different foods once a diagnosis has been made. 
The app contains neither advertisements nor any hidden costs such as in-app purchases.
-----
Why use this app?
-----
If you believe that you may be suffering from some form of food intolerance or food allergy it is essential to keep a food and symptoms diary for about 2 weeks. With the help of such a food and journal, the medical professional you are consulting can narrow down the reasons for your symptoms. This means they can focus on the right follow-up (eg. H2 breath test) and thus reach an accurate diagnosis.

The app can also be used after diagnosis. Different foods need to be tested to establish a person‚Äôs individual tolerance level, e.g. fructose or FODMAP levels. Therefore, keeping a food and symptoms diary makes sense. 

The app is simple and intuitive. You can record your daily meals by entering them into the journal or simply taking a photo. You can also track your bowel movement or note your symptoms as well as the degree of severity and produce a clearly readable PDF which you can take to your doctor‚Äôs appointment. Symptoms can also be recorded by taking a photo, which is especially useful when you have symptoms such as rashes or other skin changes.

Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
The app can also be used for recording the symptoms of inflammatory bowel diseases such as Crohn‚Äôs disease. 

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Also patients who follow a FODMAP diet due to IBS may use this app to track their nutrition and symptoms.

-----
Questions or comments?
-----
This app has its own support forum at www.food-intolerance-network.com. If you do find any bugs please drop us a line on the website so we can fix them as fast as possible. Thank you!
----
The symptoms diary app needs the following permissions:
----
+ Photos/Media/Files, Camera: You can, for example, take a picture of your meals or ingredients lists; The files are stored on your device (SD card); The data you enter will also be stored on your device.
+ Identity, Contacts: the app will access your ‚Äúme‚Äù contact information in order to copy your email address, name and date of birth (if you have entered this information into your device) in order to personalize the diary for your doctor. These settings can be changed at any time. The app will NOT read or access any other details in your contacts and will not send any such data back to us.
+ Other: With this app you can create and send a PDF file using the network connection of your phone. There are additional reading materials (e.g. Help & Support) which can only be accessed via the internet. The license authentication is also acquired via the internet. The notifications need the phone to prevent from sleeping and run at startup.
descriptionHTML:
This mobile food and symptoms diary enables you to narrow down food intolerances such as lactose, histamine or sorbitol intolerance, fructose malabsorption or food allergies. It can also be used to determine your personal threshold (tolerance level) for different foods once a diagnosis has been made.
The app contains neither advertisements nor any hidden costs such as in-app purchases.
-----
Why use this app?
-----
If you believe that you may be suffering from some form of food intolerance or food allergy it is essential to keep a food and symptoms diary for about 2 weeks. With the help of such a food and journal, the medical professional you are consulting can narrow down the reasons for your symptoms. This means they can focus on the right follow-up (eg. H2 breath test) and thus reach an accurate diagnosis.

The app can also be used after diagnosis. Different foods need to be tested to establish a person‚Äôs individual tolerance level, e.g. fructose or FODMAP levels. Therefore, keeping a food and symptoms diary makes sense.

The app is simple and intuitive. You can record your daily meals by entering them into the journal or simply taking a photo. You can also track your bowel movement or note your symptoms as well as the degree of severity and produce a clearly readable PDF which you can take to your doctor‚Äôs appointment. Symptoms can also be recorded by taking a photo, which is especially useful when you have symptoms such as rashes or other skin changes.

Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
The app can also be used for recording the symptoms of inflammatory bowel diseases such as Crohn‚Äôs disease.

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Also patients who follow a FODMAP diet due to IBS may use this app to track their nutrition and symptoms.

-----
Questions or comments?
-----
This app has its own support forum at www.food-intolerance-network.com. If you do find any bugs please drop us a line on the website so we can fix them as fast as possible. Thank you!
----
The symptoms diary app needs the following permissions:
----
+ Photos/Media/Files, Camera: You can, for example, take a picture of your meals or ingredients lists; The files are stored on your device (SD card); The data you enter will also be stored on your device.
+ Identity, Contacts: the app will access your ‚Äúme‚Äù contact information in order to copy your email address, name and date of birth (if you have entered this information into your device) in order to personalize the diary for your doctor. These settings can be changed at any time. The app will NOT read or access any other details in your contacts and will not send any such data back to us.
+ Other: With this app you can create and send a PDF file using the network connection of your phone. There are additional reading materials (e.g. Help & Support) which can only be accessed via the internet. The license authentication is also acquired via the internet. The notifications need the phone to prevent from sleeping and run at startup.
summary: Food journal for lactose, histamine, fructose malabsorption & other intolerances

comments: I absolutely love this app. You can put as much detail as you want regarding what you ate, medicines you had and symptoms you experienced. It is all beautifully displayed and it is very easy to access any previous data to see what may have caused you problems. Highly recommended. I would give the app 10 if I could.

I am struggling with food intolerance, and this is so helpful and easy. I'm 
starting to notice patterns and connections very quickly.

I wish I could have gotten a demo to test out rather than have to purchase 
it outright. Fortunately, I love the app and it serves my purpose really 
well. PDF export does hang -in the sense that the progress indicator never 
ecompletes but the PDF is already created in the background. It would be 
good to have a CSV export as well to further analyse the data in a 
spreadsheet.

For a while, the app let me keep my entries for previous days.  But once I converted the entries to pdf & emailed them to myself, those entries disappeared from the app.  I could live with that. But then after that, each day's entries would disappear at about midnight, so I can't review several days worth of entries at a time, which I would like the ability to do.
Great lean App! I would love one new feature: For each entry you could display checkboxes for common allergens, so I can mark all meals which contain lactose easily

title: IBS Diet
description:
IBS Diet application is based on The Digestive Clearing Diet, a simple to follow  program based on diet books, Digestive Health  and Healing Digestive Disorders to help people identify and eliminate problem foods that cause digestive discomfort. 
The application includes a step by step program with dietary recommendations, foods to avoid, stress release exercises and an easy to use food, mood and exercise tracker to record all your progress. 
The application also includes dozens of digestion friendly meals and recipes, instructional videos, success story videos and a dietary report. The program is free! Try it out!

Your complete Ibs Diet and ibs foods treatment plan matched to your irritable bowel syndrome symptoms. 
All the most effective IBS diets, gluten free or high or low fiber. All the right irritable bowel syndrome treatment information explaining what irritable bowel syndrome means its causes, what tests are required and how it is best treated whether through diet, medication or complementary therapy. 
Everything about IBS treatment that you would get from consulting a specialist Gastroenterologist and Dietitian. 
Enter your symptoms to get an expert IBS diet plan matched for bloating, diarrhea or constipation. Begin with the Starter diet to ensure no simple own goals and then move on to the next diet if necessary. 
Use the Diet Checker to get extra guidance along the way.
While following your ibs diet, low FODMAP etc., we will teach you about how the gut works and why foods have their impact. 
You will have idea about each symptom (bloating, diarrhoea, constipation, pain etc.) and teach you about them, their investigation and management. 

A Symptom Tracker Application is offered at a small additional cost, but this is not needed to use the expert diets mentioned above.

Use this application to identify foods as friendly or not friendly when following the Ibs Diet. Our complete list of foods will help you stay on track at home or on the go. Our easy to use search feature will help you find the foods you are looking for.

Features include:

- Comprehensive list of foods, to make finding foods for your ibs diet easier.
- Search by food name.
- Lookup by food category.
- General Ibs Diet and irritable bowel syndrome, Crohn's disease, Colitis, and Lactose Intolerence info.

This application was created by a software developer with Irritable Bowel Syndrome  who found the Ibs Diet to be very effective in avoiding trigger foods. It includes the following key features:

- Clear and simple Ibs Diet rating system
- Database of foods and ingredients

- Search by food name and filter by category/rating to find exactly what you want

If you have irritable bowel syndrome and are following the Ibs Diet to improve your digestive health by avoiding trigger foods then this A to Z food list is for you.

Note: this app is provided for educational purposes only, please ensure you seek the advice of a qualified doctor before making changes to your diet.

Get the Ibs Diet Application NOW! it's FREE!

title: UC and CD
description:
Install the app for up-to-date information on ulcerative colitis (UC) and Crohn's disease (CD)!

Every year the prevalence of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is steadily increasing, and if you are in the number of cases, this application is for you.

- Read news on the treatment and diagnosis of ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease.
- Learn about nutrition and sports in UC and CD.
- Read the stories of people with IBD, share their experiences and get feedback.
- Set reminders for taking medication.
- Chat with people in real time.
- Keep Diaries of food, stool, weight, temperature, abdominal pain and cramps to monitor the current state.
- Add Notes.

title: Doc4Me - IBD Doctor Search & Transition Aid
description:
Doc4Me is a mobile application developed by The NASPGHAN Foundation in collaboration with the Crohn‚Äôs & Colitis Foundation of America to help adolescents and young adults with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) identify an adult practitioner to whom to transition from pediatric to adult-centered care.
Doc4Me, will assist patients in finding a physician who treats adult IBD patients.
It will also help prepare them for their first appointment with their new doctor and provide them with links to available resources to improve their transition process.
The database of GI practitioners who are listed in the app represent all 50 U.S. states.

For more information, go to: www.doc4me-app.com

title: Nutri-IBD
description:
Welcome to the Nutri-IBD online diary! 
Nutri-IBD is an international study group that investigates the effects of food and other daily activities on various diseases. With your help we will collect data on disease relapses and remissions and associate them with preceding triggers. After acquiring data from multiple participants from around the world, we will identify risk factors for disease exacerbations and uncover novel ways to harness food and other non-pharmaceutical interventions to combat the disease. 
By using this dairy you will be able to log food, symptoms, including ones related to poop, school attendance, sports, medications, including supplements, and emotional stress. The more you log, the better we understand your daily routine and the factors that may affect you.
This application is meant to be used by children and adults alike.
Feel free to contact us for inquiries and to report bugs at nutri-ibd@weizmann.ac.il.
We thank you for your participation in this exciting study.
The Nutri-IBD study group.

title: Tummi FODMAP - IBS Food Diary
description:
Tummi FODMAP is the leading App to support your adoption of a low FODMAP diet to alleviate IBS symptoms. 

The low FODMAP diet is a therapeutic approach for those suffering from IBS symptoms. This diet-as-a-therapy starts by removing all high-FODMAP foods from your diet for up to six weeks, avoiding only those foods that might be triggers. Dietitians recommend maintaining a FODMAP food diary to support the change in your diet and helping you beat your IBS.

The low-FODMAP diet is an evidence-based approach. Leading studies have found it leads to improvement in 7 out of 10 patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome.

The Tummi FODMAP app is available completely for free to help users beat their IBS without any need for prescriptions, supplements or ongoing therapy. Once your symptoms improve, the app supports the process to methodically add back the various FODMAP food groups one at a time to see which ones you can tolerate. The reintroduction process allows you to achieve a better-balanced diet enjoying a wider variety of foods. 

Tummi allows you to search for your favourite foods from our directory of over 20,000 different meals and food items so that you can quickly identify low FODMAP foods that are kind to your gut.

The diet is not forever. It‚Äôs more like detective work to see which FODMAPS trigger IBS symptoms. The Tummi food diary and symptom tracker can help you navigate the FODMAP diet successfully.

Tummi App is designed to support people with an IBS diagnosis through this detective work. The Tummi FODMAP App allows users to check foods for FODMAPs, maintain a food diary, record flare-ups and identify the foods that trigger your IBS symptoms. 

The App has helped thousands of people to resolve issues with IBS symptoms including poor digestion, wind, diarrhea, constipation, abdominal pain and bloating. 

Key features:
‚Ä¢ Search meals to check FODMAP status, our directory includes 20,000 prepared meals found in supermarkets around the world
‚Ä¢ Log meals and flare-ups in a user friendly food diary
‚Ä¢ Quickly learn which foods your IBS is sensitive to
‚Ä¢ Build your personal library of favourite low FODMAP meals for quick entry
‚Ä¢ Share therapeutic outcomes with your clinician/dietitian
‚Ä¢ Use our health tracker function to monitor your progress through the FODMAP diet
‚Ä¢ Learn to maintain a balanced diet avoiding foods associated with flare-ups
‚Ä¢ Develop strategies to keep uncomfortable symptoms, like bloating, in check. Many users go back to the app from time to time to keep tabs on their low FODMAP adherence

The app should be used in consultation with a healthcare professional.

The low FODMAP diet app has been developed based on the research and clinical studies on IBS completed by King's College London (KCL) and Monash University in Melbourne, Australia.


WARNING: This application and the information that it contains do NOT constitute medical advice and should NOT serve as the basis for any medical decision by you or anyone else. The application provides indicative FODMAP scoring for prepared foods and meals, we always recommend you read the product label before consuming any product. The application is NOT suitable for general weight-loss dieting, the avoidance of allergens in food and drink and other general dietary adherence.

comments: This app has helped me a great deal. I suffer with IBS and knowing what is high or low FODMAP has made a great impact on my health and life. The best app and help I've had in years.

Just downloaded already deleting. I'm want to use any app to track my foods and then symptoms, this app doesn't even allow donut as an input. No symptom option possibility of indigestion/acid reflux/heart burn You should be able to add personalised foods to the app. Let me know when you've added this facilities and symptoms and i may reconsider downloading again
Great App, really useful tracker to support the FODMAP diet

Design and concept are great since I've been tracking everything in a notebook, but when you go to input meals it has a super limited number of meals it will actually accept. Would also be nice to have a calendar feature for planning meals if you're into that. Back to paper for now I guess...

title: Diarrhea: Causes, Diagnosis, and Management
description:
Diarrhea, also spelled diarrhoea, is the condition of having at least three loose or liquid bowel movements each day. It often lasts for a few days and can result in dehydration due to fluid loss. Signs of dehydration often begin with loss of the normal stretchiness of the skin and irritable behaviour. This can progress to decreased urination, loss of skin color, a fast heart rate, and a decrease in responsiveness as it becomes more severe. Loose but non-watery stools in babies who are exclusively breastfed, however, are normal. 
The most common cause is an infection of the intestines due to either a virus, bacteria, or parasite ‚Äì a condition also known as gastroenteritis. These infections are often acquired from food or water that has been contaminated by feces, or directly from another person who is infected. The three types of diarrhea are: short duration watery diarrhea, short duration bloody diarrhea, and persistent diarrhea (lasting more than two weeks). The short duration watery diarrhea may be due to an infection by cholera, although this is rare in the developed world. If blood is present it is also known as dysentery. A number of non-infectious causes can result in diarrhea. These include lactose intolerance, irritable bowel syndrome, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, celiac disease, inflammatory bowel disease, hyperthyroidism, bile acid diarrhea, and a number of medications. In most cases, stool cultures to confirm the exact cause are not required. 
==========================
APP FEATURES
==========================
This exclusive app will help to understand the Diarrhea symptoms, Diarrhea Treatment, Diarrhea causes, Diarrhea diagnosis, Diarrhea Prognosis, Diarrhea Epidemiology and history.

All these features are available for free.

title: GI OnDEMAND
description:
GI OnDemand, powered by Gastro Girl, gives you access to digestive health experts and support anywhere, anytime.

Gastroenterologist, registered dietitians, psychologists and nurse health coaches with specific expertise working with patients with chronic gastrointestinal (GI) symptoms or conditions like irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) or inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) are available on-demand or via scheduled video calls using your smartphone or tablet.

GI OnDemand can help support you between office visits and serve as your virtual care team in partnership with your physician.

GI OnDemand Features:

1. A Trusted Network of board-certified and leading Gastroenterologists (all are members of The American College of Gastroenterology) who can help:

‚Ä¢ If you are a current patient of a gastroenterologist in the GI OnDemand network and want to conduct virtual appointments and follow-ups between office visits.

‚Ä¢ If you have been diagnosed with a specific GI condition by your doctor and need to see a gastroenterologist.

‚Ä¢ If you need a second-opinion from a gastroenterologist.

‚Ä¢ If you need a gastroenterologist who specializes in a particular area of GI, such as IBS or IBD (Crohn‚Äôs disease, ulcerative colitis) gastroparesis, GERD, or Liver disease (such as fatty liver, hepatitis).

2. GI Registered Dietitians/nutritional counselors who can:

‚Ä¢ Help you follow a specific dietary treatment, such as the low FODMAP diet.

‚Ä¢ Help you identify and reduce exposure to foods that trigger your symptoms.

‚Ä¢ Answer your questions on food replacements, elimination diets, nutritional supplementation and more.

‚Ä¢ Work in partnership with your physician to help you manage your symptoms.


3. Behavioral health counselors/GI clinical psychologists who can help you:

‚Ä¢ Understand and manage the psychological aspects that may be triggering or impacting your digestive health symptoms like stress, anxiety, PTSD, or depression.

‚Ä¢ Provide evidence-based treatment options like hypnosis via private and secure video calls.

‚Ä¢ Work in partnership with your physician to help you manage your symptoms

4. GI Nurse Health Coaches can help you:

‚Ä¢ Comply with your doctor‚Äôs treatment recommendations.

‚Ä¢ Understand and prepare for upcoming procedures like and endoscopy or colonoscopy.

‚Ä¢ Get answers to your questions regarding medications, side effects.

‚Ä¢ Support you between office visits as your health coach.


GI Symptoms/Conditions GI OnDemand Experts Commonly Treat Include:

Abdominal pain
Acid Reflux
Bloating
Celiac disease
Colorectal Cancer
Crohn‚Äôs Disease
Constipation
Diverticulitis
Diarrhea
Flatulence/Gas
Fatty liver disease
Gallbladder disease
Gallstones
Gastroparesis
GERD
Hepatitis
Inflammatory Bowel Disease IBD)
Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
Nausea / Vomiting
Pancreatitis
Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO)
and more.

GI OnDemand is offered as a convenience and does not replace your primary care doctor or gastroenterologist.

Our goal is to work in partnership with your physician(s) and provide access to the digestive health expertise and support you need between office visits to comply with your doctor‚Äôs recommended treatment plans.

title: Poocount Lite - Toilet Journal
description:
Poocount is an app that keeps track of your bowel movements. You can easily add new entries and see a chart of all your bowel movements over time. (All the data stays on your device so you keep control over them)
We hope the app will be useful for you.

Why a Poocount app? (guess we have to answer this question :-)
An increasing number of people has Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD, Crohn/Ulcerative colitis or Colitis ulcerosa). There are lots of indicators of the severity of the illness, one of them being the amount of time you spend on the toilet. From time to time I ask myself if I am better now than, say 3 months ago. Usually my brain blocks here because it‚Äôs rather hard to remember the state of being some months ago. 
That's when I decided to develop a small app that can help me with this problem. For the time this is rather a weekend project, but hopefully it will be useful for you. I hope you don't mind when it takes some days to respond to questions.

recentChanges: Add info about new Poocount version
comments: It's pretty bare compared to the paid version, almost by too much. You can only track the date, time, whether you pooped (not even how it looked or felt) and whether there was blood, and that's it. I don't think you can track constipation either, just diarrhea. I also found a glitch where you can't just delete an entry, you also have to exit and reenter the app to make it disappear.
5 stars right off the top. It may change after i open and use it, However I am rating this app developer 5 stars for Effort, and willingness to improve. TY
This app is so very helpful, especially for us j-pouchers. Thanks and I hope more IBD people become aware of how useful it is
It won't let me download it. I have tried multiple times, and restarted my device many times. I will change my review, when I can actually use it.

title: Stomach Disease Treatments - Diagnosis 2019
description:
Stomach Disease Treatments provides medical treatments info including appendix and other intestinal disease like fibroids.

Pain in the belly (abdomen) can come from conditions affecting a variety of organs. The abdomen is an health condition anatomical area that is bounded by the lower margin of the ribs above, the pelvic bone (pubic ramus) below, and the flanks on each side. Although abdominal pain can arise from the tissues of the abdominal wall that surround the abdominal cavity (for example, skin and abdominal wall muscles), the term abdominal pain generally is used to describe pain originating from organs within the abdominal cavity (for example, beneath the skin and muscles). These organs include the stomach, small intestine, colon, liver, gallbladder, and pancreas. Occasionally, pain may be felt in the abdomen even though it is arising from organs that are close to but not within the abdominal cavity, for example, the lower lungs, the kidneys, and the uterus or ovaries. This latter type of pain is called "referred" pain because the pain, though originating outside the abdomen, is being referred to (felt) in the abdominal area.
 
Abdominal pain can be acute and sudden in onset, or the pain can be chronic and longstanding. Abdominal health problem health problem pain may be minor and of no great significance, or it can reflect a major problem involving one of the organs in the abdomen. The characteristics of the pain -- location, timing, duration, infectious disease etc. are important in diagnosing its cause. Persisting abdominal pain should be evaluated by a physician.
 
The treatments for gi disorders pain depend on the diagnosis. The majority of conditions which cause stomach ache will pass on their own without medical treatments ‚Äì for example if you‚Äôre suffering from trapped wind or a gastrointestinal.

If you think the pain could be related to an underlying stomach condition such as IBS, or you have sharp and severe pain then you should talk to a doctor. If needed they can give you a prescription for digestive health, or discuss some medical information lifestyle changes which could help ease the pain. If you have suspected gallstones, kidney stones or appendicitis then you will need hospital treatment.

If you‚Äôre not sure whether you need to see a GP about your stomach ache, you can always use our disease guide first.
Various causes of abdominal pain include, but are not limited to, indigestion after eating, gallstones and gallbladder inflammation (cholecystitis), pregnancy, gas, inflammatory bowel disease (ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease), appendicitis, ulcers, gastritis, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), pancreatitis, gastroenteritis (viral or bacterial), parasite infection, endometriosis, kidney stones (nephrolithiasis), abdominal muscle injury, abdominal hernia, lactose intolerance, gluten intolerance (celiac disease), food poisoning, menstrual cramps, peritonitis, serositis, ischemic bowel disease, vasculitis, abdominal aneurysm, abdominal organ injury from trauma, and constipation.
 
Disclaimer : If you think you may have a upset stomach problem or need to learn how to better care for your stomach, consultation with a doctor may be in order. Don‚Äôt use this guide for main diagnose medical books. Stomach problems can be difficult to diagnose because many stomach conditions share similar symptoms. An evaluation is key to effective treatment.

title: Carenity
description:
Carenity is a social network for patients affected by a chronic disease and their caregivers. Diabetes, cancer, multiple sclerosis, fibromyalgia, Crohn‚Äôs disease, obesity, depression‚Ä¶

You cannot seem to find relevant answers to your questions? You are feeling misunderstood? You are not alone! Carenity has an active community for every disease.

Download the app and join the community!

SHARE WITH PEOPLE LIKE YOU
  - Tell your story

  - Talk to those who have real experience with an illness
  - Share tips and advice on how to live a better life with the disease

title: Ada ‚Äì your health companion
description:
Ada helps you and your loved ones check symptoms and discover what might be causing them ‚Äì day or night without an appointment. Whatever‚Äôs bothering you, from stomach problems to headache, Ada‚Äôs free symptom checker can help you find answers and let you know if you should see a doctor.

 Join the 10 million people who have already downloaded the world's most popular symptom check.‚Ä® Doctors trained Ada for years, so you can get a prediagnosis within minutes. 


How do free symptom checks work?

You answer simple questions about your own or someone else‚Äôs health and symptoms.
Ada‚Äôs AI assesses your answers against its medical dictionary of thousands of disorders and medical conditions.
You receive a personalized assessment report that tells you what could be wrong and what to do next.


What can you expect from an assessment?

- Data privacy and security ‚Äì we apply the strictest data regulations to protect you and keep your information private.
- Smart results ‚Äì our core system connects medical knowledge with intelligent technology.
- Personalized health information ‚Äì your guidance is personal to your unique health profile. 
- Assessments for loved ones ‚Äì if you assess someone else, their information stays separate from your own. 
- Health checks ‚Äì your assessments include information that may be relevant and helpful to your doctor. 
- 24/7 access ‚Äì you can use the free symptom checker anytime, anywhere.


What can you tell Ada?

Ada answers medical questions of every kind. Here are some of the most common searches:

Symptoms
- Fever
- Allergic rhinitis
- Loss of appetite
- Headache
- Abdominal pain and tenderness 
- Nausea
- Fatigue
- Vomiting
- Dizziness


Medical conditions:
- Common cold 
- Influenza infection (flu)
- Viral sinusitis
- Diabetes
- Tension headache
- Migraine
- Chronic pain
- Fibromyalgia
- Arthritis
- Allergy
- Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
- Anxiety disorder
- Depression

Categories:
- Skin conditions such as rashes, acne, insect bites
- Pregnancy 
- Children‚Äôs health
- Sleeping problems
- Indigestion issues, such as vomiting, diarrhea
- Eye infections

Disclaimer
The Ada Health App is a Class I medical device in the European Union. Registration in other markets is pending.

We want to hear from you. If you have any feedback or just want to get in touch, reach us at hello@ada.com

comments: Pretty accurate heading. Again HEADING and not a diagnostic So people won't get it wrong about the app. Extremelly helpful, since the test I've inputed on was an already medical confirmed diagnosis and ADA has provided three oprions which one of them is the one I am on current medical treatment. So, I will definitely use it as a pre-docs visit since it helps to describe symptoms to the physician. First use no ads so far, which is great. Lets see if it stays this way.

I absolutely adore this app, I don't see myself ever getting rid of it. If you're ever unsure of what you have or need a guideline for what you may have, it is the most perfect app. It doesn't make you panic, it explains everything and is so calming when you're worried for the worst. Thank you to the creators! I adore this app and I'm so thankful for it!

This is a really awesome app, I use it every time I feel unwell. And it saved me so many trips to the doctor. The UI looks modern, descriptions of either symptoms or diseases is accurate while also easy to understand. And the best thing? it doesn't have ads, some kind of overpriced subscription or anything like that. this one is my must have.

It is generally a good app, but I put my symptoms in and it focused more on my mild headache and other small things than the actual problem that caused me to try this in the first place which was more important than that head ache, it does this quite a lot but other than this, it's quite good! It is a good way to track symptoms and I haven't seen many ads but it does need to work on the symptom assessment a bit more, but that said, it is hard to make that perfect but it can help.

This app is extremely helpful, I've used it dozens of times since I downloaded. Love that it remembers details about people other than me. It would be cool to have the option to import my medical records .... Not sure if that is something that would be possible to do? Either way, I've love this app, and it never takes long before I feel the need to download it onto a new phone.

title: Constipation Disease
description:
This Constipation Disease app have complete information of Disease. Constipation most commonly occurs when waste or stool moves too slowly through the digestive tract, causing it to become hard and dry. 

Constipation refers to bowel movements that are infrequent or hard to pass. The stool is often hard and dry. Other symptoms may include abdominal pain, bloating, and feeling as if one has not completely passed the bowel movement. Complications from constipation may include hemorrhoids, anal fissure or fecal impaction. The normal frequency of bowel movements in adults is between three per day and three per week. Babies often have three to four bowel movements per day while young children typically have two to three per day. Constipation has many causes.

How long does constipation last? The answer to this question lies captive in the cause of constipation. When constipation is just something that happens after a party, then it should be over within a day or to. But if it was caused by an incorrect lifestyle, then it can last for years, even the rest of your life, if you do not have it treated correctly and change your lifestyle.

The first type of constipation that is very common is acute constipation, which can also cause back pain. Sometimes, it can also cause fever, nausea, and vomiting.

title: Bearable - Symptoms & Mood tracker
description:
‚úÖ All health tracking in one place

Tired of juggling multiple apps to keep track of your mood, symptoms, sleep, exercise, diet, and medication? We think all of this should be kept in one convenient place so that you and your health professional can get the full picture.

‚úÖ Reclaim control over your well-being

Bearable empowers people to reclaim control over their well-being by making mood and symptom tracking simple, convenient, and accessible to all. Making entries in our health diary is quick and effortless, so you can focus more energy on getting better.  

The app has been shaped by our community of thousands of people with varying chronic health issues.

‚úÖ Gain useful insights with just a few clicks a day

With just a few simple clicks each day our intelligent health diary can help you to gain insights into which daily activities and health factors are positively and negatively affecting your mental and physical health.


Bearable helps you to:

‚úîÔ∏è Record your mood and symptoms in seconds, or go into more detail with an additional note. 
‚úîÔ∏è Fully customise your daily activities and health factors, such as sleep, diet, exercise and medication/supplements. 
‚úîÔ∏è Gain insights into how your daily activities and health factors impact your mood and symptoms using our graphs, calendar and stats pages.
‚úîÔ∏è Keep everything in one place with our neat health timeline, so that you can get the full picture. Use our search function to filter just what you want to see or show your health professional.
‚úîÔ∏è Come prepared to your next doctor or therapist appointment - no need to struggle to remember a detailed health timeline for the last week or month.
‚úîÔ∏è Make journaling a healthy habit with our quick, simple and enjoyable entry process.

And there‚Äôs much more‚Ä¶

‚ûï Set Reminders - Fully customise your reminders, whether it's a general reminder to make a diary entry or a reminder to take your medication and supplements. 
‚ûï Share and Export -  Export data securely to yourself or your health professional
‚ûï Automatic health data sync - You can choose to allow the app to automatically gather data such as Sleep and Steps taken from your phone.
‚ûï Dark mode - Change at night to a display easier on the eyes.
‚ûï Restore data across devices - Restore your data between Apple & Android devices.


üîê PRIVATE & SECURE

Rest easy knowing your data is encrypted securely on our servers. You have full control over your data and can delete it from within the app at any time.  It‚Äôs important to emphasise that we will never under any circumstances sell any personal data to anyone.


üíü MADE BY PEOPLE WHO UNDERSTAND AND CARE

Created by individuals who have lived with mental and physical health issues themselves.  With feedback and feature requests from a research group of thousands of people with a wide variety of chronic diseases and health conditions, including Anxiety, Depression, CFS (ME), MS (Multiple Sclerosis), Fibromyalgia, Endometriosis, Bipolar, BPD, PTSD, Migraines, Headaches, Vertigo, Cancer (Chemo Symptoms), Arthritis, Crohns, Diabetes, IBS and IBD.  Our aim is to make our symptom tracker simple and accessible to everyone, even if suffering from the fatigue and brain fog that often accompanies many conditions.

We have created a real sense of community around Bearable and will continue to listen closely to those who need it most.  We are committed to continue improving upon this app that could help many people start to feel like they can reclaim control over their health.  If you have any questions, feedback or feature requests, please send them over to james@bearable.app.  We‚Äôd love to hear from you.

comments: This is absolutely the best of its kind. I have never seen such a comprehensive, customizable, well-designed app that serves as many functions as this one. I've already shown it to multiple friends/therapists. For those of you moaning about the cost... seriously, getting the subscription will set you back just over $2/month. I work professionally with highly impoverished individuals who do have to count every penny, but come on. Most people can shell out a couple bucks without harm.

The app lets you log your mood, any symptoms you are having, and a number of factors that you think may be affecting your mood/symptoms. The default categories to log are good, but you can add/remove/edit all of the categories to fit you better. It's super easy to fill out, even when I'm not feeling well. It (sometimes) feels like I'm logging meaningless information, but then when I click on the Insights tab, it shows me tons of relevant information about which factors are influencing my mood (or any other symptom I log!). Turns out listening to music and video chats work wonders for my mood--good to know! This is also a wonderful way to record how I'm feeling over time--it lets me easily decipher long-term changes in my wellbeing, which is great information to discuss with medical professionals.

I really like this app, it's easy to use and the design is nice and the ability to customize it to your needs is great. However, the syncing isn't very reliable. I have a phone and a tablet, and downloaded it on both, I tried to log in on the tablet, and only a few entries were visible. Later I went to look at the one on my phone, and half the entries are gone, and so are factors I added. I want to keep using this app, but if it's going to randomly forget things that's a problem.

I have tried multiple times in the past to find a way that I could easily log my moods in a way that felt nuanced and meaningful but also flexible and customizable, but this is the first app I have ever seen that got it right. For once, I am finding it convenient to do quick check ins and even monitor my food and water intake which I never thought I'd have the patience to do. You don't have to get premium, but it's well worth it at least to support a great app.

Brilliant App & well worth paying for. I wanted an app to record daily symptoms to enable me to give an accurate report to my GP. This app has everything I wanted & more. Being able to write notes by each symptom is so helpful & the insight reports are incredible. I did have a little snag when I first signed up for the free trial, but I made contact, explained the situation & James helped me to sort it all out. The app has been fantastic ever since. Thank you bearable team üôèüèªü•∞

title: IBD News
description: Living with or caring for someone with a chronic health condition, such as, IBD is challenging enough. Searching for answers shouldn't be. How many ways can one search for news about how IDB is treated? Would it be treatments? How about medications? Drugs? Therapies? Then, if the condition falls under an umbrella term like IBD, the search can quickly become more complicated and time consuming. IBD News does the research for you and gathers the latest news from multiple sources. News is then delivered to your phone or tablet as it becomes available allowing you to get back to what is important...health!

title: Food and Symptoms Diary LITE
description:
This mobile food and symptoms diary enables you to narrow down food intolerances such as lactose, histamine or sorbitol intolerance, fructose malabsorption or food allergies. It can also be used to determine your personal threshold (tolerance level) for different foods once a diagnosis has been made. 
The app contains neither advertisements nor any hidden costs such as in-app purchases.
-----
What does "Lite version" mean?
-----
This version is free, there is also a paid PRO version. In the LITE version, you cannot generate a PDF, log your bowel movement, set a reminder, or import data.
If you like this diary app, you can later buy the PRO version and then export your diary entries from the LITE version and import it into the PRO version.
------
Why use this app?
-----
If you believe that you may be suffering from some form of food intolerance or food allergy it is essential to keep a food and symptoms diary for about 2 weeks. With the help of such a food and journal, the medical professional you are consulting can narrow down the reasons for your symptoms. This means they can focus on the right follow-up (eg. H2 breath test) and thus reach an accurate diagnosis.

The app can also be used after diagnosis. Different foods need to be tested to establish a person‚Äôs individual tolerance level, e.g. fructose or FODMAP levels. Therefore, keeping a food and symptoms diary makes sense. 

The app is simple and intuitive. You can record your daily meals by entering them into the journal or simply taking a photo. You can also track your bowel movement (PRO Version only) or note your symptoms as well as the degree of severity and produce a clearly readable PDF (PRO Version only) which you can take to your doctor‚Äôs appointment. Symptoms can also be recorded by taking a photo, which is especially useful when you have symptoms such as rashes or other skin changes.

Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
The app can also be used for recording the symptoms of inflammatory bowel diseases such as Crohn‚Äôs disease. 

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Also patients who follow a FODMAP diet due to IBS may use this app to track their nutrition and symptoms.

-----
Questions or comments?
-----
This app has its own support forum at www.food-intolerance-network.com. If you do find any bugs please drop us a line on the website so we can fix them as fast as possible. Thank you!
----
The symptoms diary app needs the following permissions:
----
+ Photos/Media/Files, Camera: You can, for example, take a picture of your meals or ingredients lists; The files are stored on your device (SD card); The data you enter will also be stored on your device.
+ Identity, Contacts: the app will access your ‚Äúme‚Äù contact information in order to copy your email address, name and date of birth (if you have entered this information into your device) in order to personalize the diary for your doctor. These settings can be changed at any time. The app will NOT read or access any other details in your contacts and will not send any such data back to us.
+ Other: With this app you can create and send a PDF file using the network connection of your phone. There are additional reading materials (e.g. Help & Support) which can only be accessed via the internet. The license authentication is also acquired via the internet. The notifications need the phone to prevent from sleeping and run at startup.

H2 breath test) and thus reach an accurate diagnosis.

The app can also be used after diagnosis. Different foods need to be tested to establish a person‚Äôs individual tolerance level, e.g. fructose or FODMAP levels. Therefore, keeping a food and symptoms diary makes sense.

The app is simple and intuitive. You can record your daily meals by entering them into the journal or simply taking a photo. You can also track your bowel movement (PRO Version only) or note your symptoms as well as the degree of severity and produce a clearly readable PDF (PRO Version only) which you can take to your doctor‚Äôs appointment. Symptoms can also be recorded by taking a photo, which is especially useful when you have symptoms such as rashes or other skin changes.

Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD)
The app can also be used for recording the symptoms of inflammatory bowel diseases such as Crohn‚Äôs disease.

Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS)
Also patients who follow a FODMAP diet due to IBS may use this app to track their nutrition and symptoms.

-----
Questions or comments?
-----
This app has its own support forum at www.food-intolerance-network.com. If you do find any bugs please drop us a line on the website so we can fix them as fast as possible. Thank you!
----
The symptoms diary app needs the following permissions:
----
+ Photos/Media/Files, Camera: You can, for example, take a picture of your meals or ingredients lists; The files are stored on your device (SD card); The data you enter will also be stored on your device.
+ Identity, Contacts: the app will access your ‚Äúme‚Äù contact information in order to copy your email address, name and date of birth (if you have entered this information into your device) in order to personalize the diary for your doctor. These settings can be changed at any time. The app will NOT read or access any other details in your contacts and will not send any such data back to us.
+ Other: With this app you can create and send a PDF file using the network connection of your phone. There are additional reading materials (e.g. Help & Support) which can only be accessed via the internet. The license authentication is also acquired via the internet. The notifications need the phone to prevent from sleeping and run at startup.
summary: Food journal for lactose, histamine, fructose malabsorption & other intolerances

title: Gastritis Disease
description: Gastritis is inflammation of the lining of the stomach. It may occur as a short episode or may be of a long duration. There may be no symptoms but, when symptoms are present, the most common is upper abdominal pain. Other possible symptoms include nausea and vomiting, bloating, loss of appetite and heartburn. Complications may include bleeding, stomach ulcers, and stomach tumors. When due to autoimmune problems, low red blood cells due to not enough vitamin B12 may occur, a condition known as pernicious anemia. Common causes include infection with Helicobacter pylori and use of NSAIDs. Less common causes include alcohol, smoking, cocaine, severe illness, autoimmune problems, radiation therapy and Crohn's disease. Endoscopy, a type of X-ray known as an upper gastrointestinal series, blood tests, and stool tests may help with diagnosis.The symptoms of gastritis may be a presentation of a myocardial infarction. Other conditions with similar symptoms include inflammation of the pancreas, gallbladder problems, and peptic ulcer disease.

title: Digestive Index
description:
Hill‚Äôs DIGESTIVE INDEX is a free smartphone web app for veterinarians to quickly and easily score the severity of the signs of chronic enteropathy (CE) / inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) by completing one of two published scoring systems ‚Äì the chronic inflammatory bowel disease activity index (CIBDAI) or the canine chronic enteropathy clinical activity index (CCECAI). 

The total score ‚Äòdashboard‚Äô is a very easy way for you as clinician to show the severity of the problem to the owner. By reassessing the score after treatment, it also provides you an objective visual aid to show improvement (or deterioration) of the situation to the pet parent.

This app is not designed for the diagnosis of CE or IBD, only as an aid in its management. Proper diagnosis and patient management are always the responsibility of the attending veterinary surgeon. Hill‚Äôs cannot be held responsible for any claims, by the pet owner or the veterinarian, related to the diagnosis or patient management that have been applied or recommended by the veterinary healthcare team as a result of using this app.

title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome Home Remedies
description:
Home Remedies For Irritable Bowel Syndrome | At times, it can be challenging to get your irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) under control. You may find it helpful to learn about some Home Remedies.. 

Eat more fiber. Fiber is a bit of a mixed bag for IBS sufferers. It helps ease some symptoms, including constipation, but can actually worsen other symptoms like cramping and gas. Still, high-fiber foods such as fruits, vegetables, and beans are recommended as an IBS treatment if taken gradually over several weeks.

title: Chronic Disease
description:
Chronic Disease

Chronic illness affects the population worldwide.
Chronic Disease is a long-lasting condition that can be controlled but not cured.,prevention and control,treatment ,medication etc.
Preventing Chronic Disease (PCD) is now available as a free app on your mobile device, bringing you the latest and most relevant peer-reviewed research on public health efforts to prevent chronic disease.
Although chronic diseases are among the most common and costly health problems, they are also among the most preventable and most can be effectively controlled.
Chronic diseases generally cannot be prevented by vaccines or cured by medication, nor do they just disappear.

title: Constipation Diary
description:
¬©NEUROGUT 2018 CONSTIPATION STOOL INSTRUMENT
Basic description: The Constipation Stool Instrument (CSI) is a list of patient-reported symptoms for the evaluation of bowel problems associated with constipation. Constipation affects 15% of the US population. Constipation comprises of multiple symptoms that describe the frequency and difficulty with bowel movements. Because of the irregular nature of bowel habit, the multiple and variable symptoms, and difficulty with remembering symptoms as well as recall bias, it is important to prospectively assess patient-reported bowel symptoms, for use in clinical trials, and for the assessment of patients with constipation.
Authors:
Neurogut Incorporated (USA)
Objective:
To assess the presence of and severity of patient-reported bowel and abdominal symptoms related to constipation, for use in clinical trials, and assessment of patients with constipation
Therapeutic Areas:
Gastrointestinal and Digestive System Diseases
Pathological conditions, Signs and Symptoms
Therapeutic indication:
Constipation
Dyssynergic defecation
Anorectal and Colorectal diseases
Type of Clinical Outcome Assessment (COA)
Patient Reported Outcome (PRO) assessment
Original language
English for the USA
Bibliographic reference for the original questionnaire:
Meduri K, Brown CK, Attaluri A, Valestin J, Rao SSC. Validation of a Prospective Stool Diary for Assessment of Constipation.  Neurogastroenterol Motil 2011; 23 (Supplement 1): 21.






Administration:
The Constipation Stool Instrument (CSI) is a daily, self-administered questionnaire for the assessment of bowel habit. The subject is instructed to fill out all 11 items for one day by responding on each screen presented, and as it relates to each bowel movement.  It takes 1 minute to complete this App for each bowel movement.
Purpose of survey:
To accurately and more completely record each subject‚Äôs bowel and stooling habit 
To better understand the subject‚Äôs constipation problem 
To use the information to improve the health of a patient with constipation
Benefits to the Respondent:
To improve diagnosis of constipation and to identify the subject‚Äôs subtype of constipation
To help develop appropriate treatment plan
To help develop new treatments

title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome - IBS
description:
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) is a common disorder that affects the large intestine. Signs and symptoms include cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation, or both. IBS is a chronic condition that you'll need to manage long term.
Irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) affects between 6‚Äì18% of people worldwide.
This condition involves changes in frequency or form of bowel movements and lower abdominal pain.
Diet, stress, poor sleep and changes in gut bacteria may all trigger symptoms.
Install this Irritable Bowel Syndrome ‚Äì IBS App to learn all about:

Irritable Bowel Syndrome ‚Äì IBS Sings
The causes of Irritable Bowel Syndrome ‚Äì IBS.
All symptoms of Irritable Bowel Syndrome ‚Äì IBS.
Irritable Bowel Syndrome ‚Äì IBS diet guide who gives you the best 6 diet to stop PAIN.

title: Gastrointestinal USMLE S2CK QA
description:
Get +1300 Questions & answers  and prepare your Gastrointestinal   USMLE step 2 CK exam in less time and get better understanding and higher score. It's the only Gastrointestinal exam questions Bank on the android market.
Our passion to Gastrointestinal  drove us to develop this outstanding android application to help you understand and admire Gastrointestinal .

This app is intended to  students, researchers, resident, doctors, Gastrointestinal  specialists, nurses and  medical professionals and of course Medical lecturers, teachers and professors.
Get a better score in your  USMLE  (step1, step2  CS & CK), PANCE, MCAT, DAT, COMLEX, OAT, NBDE,  or PCAT exam, City and Guilds (AMSPAR) Certificates in Medical Terminology and CMA (AAMA) Medical Terminology Exams. Includes links to free interactive medical apps.
Suitable for premedical students, nursing students, medical secretaries, transcriptionists, and allied health students, in fact anyone with an interest in the language of medicine or medical education, and the most important  is to fall in love with the material, it worth all the attention.

The human gastrointestinal tract, or GI tract, or GIT is an organ system responsible for consuming and digesting foodstuffs, absorbing nutrients, and expelling waste.

The tract consists of the stomach and intestines, and is divided into the upper and lower gastrointestinal tracts. However, by the broadest definition, the GI tract includes all structures between the mouth and the anus. On the other hand, the digestive system is a broader term that includes other structures, including the digestive organs and their accessories. The tract may also be divided into foregut, midgut, and hindgut, reflecting the embryological origin of each segment.

The whole digestive tract is about nine metres (30 feet) long.

Disease

There are a number of diseases and conditions affecting the gastrointestinal system, including:

    Infection. Gastroenteritis is an inflammation of the intestines. It occurs more frequently than any other disease of the intestines.
    Cancer may occur at any point in the gastrointestinal tract, and includes mouth cancer, tongue cancer, oesophageal cancer, stomach cancer, and colorectal cancer.
    Inflammatory conditions. Ileitis is an inflammation of the ileum, Colitis is an inflammation of the large intestine.
    Appendicitis is inflammation of the vermiform appendix located at the caecum. This is a potentially fatal condition if left untreated; most cases of appendicitis require surgical intervention.

Diverticular disease is a condition that is very common in older people in industrialized countries. It usually affects the large intestine but has been known to affect the small intestine as well. Diverticulosis occurs when pouches form on the intestinal wall. Once the pouches become inflamed it is known as diverticulitis.

Inflammatory bowel disease is an inflammatory condition affecting the bowel walls, and includes the subtypes Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis. While Crohn's can affect the entire gastrointestinal tract, ulcerative colitis is limited to the large intestine. 

Several symptoms are used to indicate problems with the gastrointestinal tract:

    Vomiting, 
    Diarrhoea, 
    Constipation, 
    Blood in stool, 


Various methods of imaging the gastrointestinal tract are used:

    Radioopaque dyes may be swallowed to produce a Barium swallow
 
    An abdominal x-ray may be used to examine the lower gastrointestinal tract.

Other

    Celiac Disease
    Cholera
    Diarrhoea
    Enteric duplication cyst
    Giardiasis
    Irritable bowel syndrome
    Pancreatitis
    Peptic ulcer disease
    Yellow Fever
    Helicobacter pylori is a gram-negative spiral bacterium.

Various methods of imaging the gastrointestinal tract are used:

Radioopaque dyes may be swallowed to produce a Barium swallow

An abdominal x-ray may be used to examine the lower gastrointestinal tract.

title: PIBD Activity Calculator
description:
Pediatric IBD Activity Index Calculator is an app specially designed to be used bedside to calculate PUCAI and PCDAI in children with IBD.

It's based in the following scores specifically developed and validated for these diseases in pediatric population:

- Turner D, Otley AR, Mack D, Hyams J, de Bruijne J, Uusoue K, et al. Development, validation, and evaluation of a pediatric ulcerative colitis activity index: A prospective multicentre study. Gastroenterology. 2007;133:423-32

- Hyams JS, Ferry GD, Mandel FS, Gryboski JD, Kibort PM, Kirschner BS, et al. Development and validation of a pediatric Crohn‚Äôs disease activity index. J Pediatr Gastroenterol Nutr. 1991;12:439-47

We hope it will be useful for physicians attending children with Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis.

title: Diarrhea Home & Natural Remedies
description:
What is Diarrhea?

Diarrhea can be a very unpleasant feeling. It involves several uncontrollable bowel movements in a day that include loose stool passage, usually with no bulk in it. But a bout of diarrhea can be very beneficial to rid your body of unpleasant substances. The process can be likened to vomiting, which is very useful for the body flush out harmful toxins. But the entire procedure is so discomforting and painful that you need to find a cure for it as soon as you possibly can.

Etiology of Diarrhea
Diarrhea can be caused by a viral or bacterial infection that might enter your body when you consume contaminated water or food. It may also be caused by excessive drinking, a food allergy, anxiety, and stress, or medicinal side effects. Excess fluids passing through your large intestine, more than it can absorb, can also cause diarrhea. When parasites, bacteria, or viruses enter your bloodstream via food and water, they damage the digestive lining, thereby making it difficult for the colon to absorb fluids optimally.

Symptoms of Diarrhea

Prominent symptoms of diarrhea include watery, loose stools. Other symptoms that usually accompany diarrhea include vomit, frequent bowel movements, stomach ache, and fever, dehydration, loss of appetite, and nausea.

Types of Diarrhea

Diarrhea can either be chronic or acute depending on the duration it lasts. If your condition exceeds two to three weeks, it can be chronic. Otherwise, the status is acute.

Avoid over the counter medications and try some simple home remedies that can be very helpful in both acute and chronic diarrhea. 

If You like this App pls leave a positive review and consider rating it 5 star thank you

title: Crohns Diary
description:
Are you like one of the thousands of people who suffer from Crohn‚Äôs Disease?  How can Crohn‚Äôs Diary help?  Crohn‚Äôs Diary was designed to track information about your Crohn‚Äôs  Disease with a few screen taps. Using this information, the application will allow you to use triggers, like your stress, sleep and weather patterns, day of week, and diet, to predict and manage your Crohn‚Äôs Disease Pain and Symptoms.  Crohn‚Äôs Diary has a new ‚ÄúTrending and Forecasting‚Äù module that shows you which factors and triggers contribute to your pain and symptoms.   This will help you feel better and will allow you to take control of your disease.  Crohn‚Äôs Diary makes it easy to perform tasks like tracking your treatment progress, graphing your patterns, emailing reports, including graphical attachments to your doctor and advisors. Crohn‚Äôs Diary will also allow you to export your data to a spread sheet all with just a few screen taps. Do you want all of your Crohn‚Äôs Disease health records and information at your fingertips so that you can start feeling better.  Crohn‚Äôs Diary can help.


-	Enter, document, and track as much or as little information as you want with a few screen taps.

-	Document and Track your pain, number of evacuations,  and symptoms.

-	Track your triggers, including food, stress, location, activity, weather patterns, and sleep patterns.

-	Keep Track of which treatments really help and those that do not with the treatment Management analysis report.

-	Keep track of your health records including hospital or doctor visits, surgeries and procedures, laboratory tests and results, procedures, vital statistics, and the mental and physical symptoms you are experiencing.

-	Record your thoughts and notes.

-	Keep track of your appointments, doctor visits, your test results, surgeries and procedures.

-	Record all your therapy details, including medications and side-effects

-	Track multiple doctors and laboratories

-	Graph your patterns of experiences, email reports, including graphical attachments to your doctor so that they can help you adjust

-	Customize many features; export your data to a spread sheet for offline backup and all with just a few screen taps

-	Find out which factors and triggers contribute to your symptoms.

Please don‚Äôt give up until you can manage your Crohn‚Äôs Disease better.  

Keep all your IBS medical records and information at your fingertips with this easy-to-use journal.
Makes it easy to feel better, be happy, organized and stress-free!

title: IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome)
description:
Choose This not That for IBS (Irritable Bowel Syndrome). Inside this colorful app, you will find easy to follow suggestions on how to improve your health through nutrition and the food choices you make every day. This app provides comprehensive and actionable nutrition guidelines for how to prevent and combat IBS & symptoms. If you rather tackle health issues and risks through proper nutrition and lifestyle changes then this app is for you! Last update: Nov. 2019.

A number of features make this app so different and superior to others in the market:

‚Ä¢ Is this food good for me? This feature answers the common question about suitability of various food items for your personal situation. And it does so in an easy to understand and colorful graphic form.

‚Ä¢ Recipes. Most popular recipes on leading web sites.

‚Ä¢ Health issues often come our way in groups of two or more. They are often caused by other health complications or result in other illnesses and risks. In case of IBS, there are numerous symptoms and health risks that might accompany it. Thus, we have included separate guidelines for any of the following common symptoms and conditions along with IBS: anxiety, chronic fatigue syndrome, constipation, depression, diarrhea, excess weight, gas/flatulence, heartburn, high blood pressure, high cholesterol, indigestion and stress. Also included are guidelines for Low FODMAP & Specific Carb Diet (SCD).

‚Ä¢ Top-5 recommendations on what to eat/do, and what not to.

‚Ä¢ Food Suggestions. The best food choices within a food group, based on your personal profile. An extremely valuable tool when at restaurants or when grocery shopping. Also included are suggestions on appropriate life style choices, alternative therapies and herbal remedies, when such options are promising and available to you.

‚Ä¢ ACTIONABLE information on what is good, what is bad, and what is neutral for your condition(s). We single out specific food items, and give you an ordered list of helpful and harmful foods within each food group. 

The primary sources used by Personal Remedies are US government sources such as USDA (US Department of Agriculture), NIH (National Institute of Health) agencies, and leading clinics & universities.

Personal Remedies is the publisher of the largest collection of health and nutrition apps for chronic conditions in the market, based in metro-Boston, home to the highest ranking healthcare providers and academic institutions in the world.

This app is updated by our team on an ongoing basis. Updates happen seamlessly, and do NOT require frequent inconvenient downloads.

‚ÄúThis technology was developed using the most current clinical evidence-based information that is available in the US. Behind this technology there is a team of expert clinicians, scientists, endocrinologists, oncologists, and other specialists who are passionate about bridging the gap between expert knowledge and the patient.‚Äú 
Katya Tsaioun, PhD, Nutrition, Tufts University; L.D.N.

 ‚ÄúProper nutrition and other alternative treatments show great promise in preventing and treating many of the illnesses that we deal with every day. I encourage all my patients to follow appropriate nutrition and research other options for themselves. The Choose This Not That series are an excellent step towards improving people‚Äôs knowledge in this area.‚Äù
Shahin Tabatabaei, MD
Mass General Hospital; Harvard Medical School

‚ÄúThe Choose This Not That series of apps provide dietary recommendations focused on common chronic health problems. They are easy to understand and thus easy to implement into daily life. Most doctors would find it difficult to discuss dietary recommendations at the level of detail found in the series. They should serve as a valuable complement in helping people manage chronic illnesses through dietary and lifestyle modifications.‚Äù
Andrew S. Lenhardt, MD 
Lahey Clinic, Hamilton, MA

title: Fast Tract Diet
description:
The Fast Tract Diet App helps you identify gut friendly foods versus hard-to-digest foods, track and chart your meals and symptoms, create shopping lists and quickly look up the symptom potential for specific foods & drinks at your favorite market on the fly.

The Fast Tract Diet is based on a flexible ‚ÄúFP‚Äù point system adaptable to a variety of dietary preferences. Each food is assigned a specific point value based on its serving size and symptom potential.

The Lower The FP Points, The Lower The Symptom Potential.

The Fast Tract Diet addresses the symptoms of Functional Gastrointestinal Disorders (FGIDs), Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO) and related digestive and general health issues including:
‚Ä¢ Gas, bloating, distension and belching
‚Ä¢ Cramps, abdominal pain and indigestion
‚Ä¢ Diarrhea, constipation or altered bowel habits
‚Ä¢ Heartburn, sore throat, sinus irritation, persistent cough, sour taste, hoarseness, lump in throat feeling and post nasal drip
‚Ä¢ Respiratory symptoms
‚Ä¢ Allergic and autoimmune reactions

FGIDs, SIBO and related digestive and general health issues include, but are not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Acid and non-acid reflux
‚Ä¢ Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)
‚Ä¢ Laryngopharyngeal Reflux (LPR)
‚Ä¢ Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS)
‚Ä¢ Lactose, fructose or other carbohydrate intolerance
‚Ä¢ Celiac disease
‚Ä¢ Crohn‚Äôs disease
‚Ä¢ Diverticulitis
‚Ä¢ Asthma
‚Ä¢ Rosacea
‚Ä¢ Leaky gut and autoimmune diseases

EFFECTIVE
Read the professional reviews and genuine experiences of Fast Tract Dieters (http://digestivehealthinstitute.org/book-reviews/) based on the Fast Tract Digestion books, which describe the diet. The Fast Tract Diet was presented at Digestive Disease Week in 2013 to give gastroenterologists a new dietary alternative for SIBO related conditions.

HOW IT WORKS
It‚Äôs easy. Just follow the 3 steps:
1. Decide your daily FP goal based on the severity of your symptoms.

- For severe symptoms: 25 FP points or less (GREEN)
- For moderate symptoms: 26 ‚Äì 40 FP points (YELLOW)
- For light or no symptoms: 40 FP points and above (RED)

2. Track what you eat and drink including serving sizes and any symptoms you experience.

3. Incorporate the ‚ÄúGut Friendly Practices‚Äù into your daily routine for better digestion.

For more information on FP, FP goal setting and ‚ÄúGut Friendly Practices‚Äù, read the How Fast Tract Diet Works and Gut Friendly Practices chapters by pressing ‚Äù ? ‚Äù on the Dashboard.

DASHBOARD
This is where you start. The graph is automatically generated based on your meals (FP) and symptoms. You can see it either by week or month to track your progress on symptom relief over time.

FP FOOD LIST
Over 800 foods, drinks, condiments and supplements are already pre-calculated to help you meet your ‚ÄúFP‚Äù goal for relief.

TRACKER
Your meals and symptoms are logged here. You can log meals and symptoms from the Dashboard, FP Food List as well as within the Tracker.

MY CUSTOM FOODS
Can‚Äôt find a food in the FP Food List? Enter the nutritional facts and let the App calculate the FP and save it for future use.  You can also create your own recipes. The FP values are automatically calculated per serving making it easy to add to the Tracker.

SHOPPING LIST
Create a low FP shopping list and bring it to your local market! You can also add other household items for convenience.

FP CALCULATOR
This is your mobile food chemist to determine the FP points and symptom potential in any food, drink, etc. Once FP points are calculated, you can add the food to My Custom Foods for future reference.

FAST TRACT DIET
Read about the Fast Tract Diet and Fast Tract Diet App in several concise chapters. Additional resources including books, individual consultation and a community of Fast Tract Dieters on Facebook are also found here.

Credits for various Icons
- https://icons8.com/
- http://www.flaticon.com/
  Icons made by Freepik from www.flaticon.com
  Icon made by Picol from www.flaticon.com
